business.headline: Struggling to find your old mutual fund investments? Let Sebi's Mitra help With over 7.5 million inactive folios across different asset management companies (AMCs), Mitra is designed to help investors recover their forgotten investments.
Does marriage impact your credit score? All you need to know While regular payments can improve both scores, any late or default on payments can considerably impact both the scores.

India's exports under pressure as US and EU tighten trade policiesUS President Donald Trump's plan to impose reciprocal tariffs from April is a major concern for Indian exporters, particularly in sectors like automobiles, agriculture, and manufacturing.

Nifty falls for 10th straight day, longest daily losing streak since 1996 launchNifty has registered a 10-day losing streak amid multiple triggers, including relentless selling by foreign investors and fears of an escalating trade war.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as trade war fears keep investors on edgeThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 96.01 points lower at 72,989.93 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 36.65 points to 22,082.65.

Stock market correction: Here's how to pick quality stocksDuring a market downturn, investors must be careful about stock selection. Choosing the right stocks can help minimise losses and create long-term gains.
Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal wants weekly updates from staff: ReportUnder the new policy, employees must send a short email every week highlighting 3-5 key tasks they have completed.
Explained: Why popular cryptocurrencies are crashing suddenlyOver the last 24 hours, Bitcoin, the world's largest cryptocurrency, has lost 8.83%, currently trading at $83,461.02.

IPOs in hibernation mode: Why have public listings dried up?The last mainboard IPO to open for subscription was Quality Power on February 14, 2025. Since then, there has been no fresh activity in the public listing space.
Microchip to cut 2,000 jobs, impacting 9% of global workforceMicrochip has reported five straight quarters of declining sales, with fourth-quarter revenue and profits falling below expectations.

Mixue, China's bubble tea giant, makes a strong IPO debut with 47% stock jumpMixue, popular for its low-cost drinks and Snow King mascot, generated $444 million by offering 17 million shares at HK$202.5 each.

Nifty stares at worst monthly losing streak. Can March turn the tide?If the situation does not improve in March, Nifty could fall for the sixth straight month, something that has never happened before. This could have a drastic impact on investor sentiments and make the situation worse.

entertainment.headline: Actor Shoaib Ibrahim reacts to divorce rumours: Dipika ne diya mujhe dhokhaTelevision couple, Dipika Kakar and Shoaib Ibrahim have found themselves at the center of the separation rumours. The two addressed the same in their new vlog on YouTube.

Shonali Bose on DU, Miranda House's objection to Ziddi Girls: It was heartbreakingPrime Video's Ziddi Girls faced backlash from sections of Delhi University and Miranda House students over perceived negative portrayal, but director Shonali Bose clarifies the trailer was misunderstood and most students ultimately enjoyed the show.

Anora OTT release: When and where to watch the Oscar-winning Best FilmThe Oscar-winning film 'Anora' is set to stream on JioHotstar from March 17. Directed by Sean Baker and starring Mikey Madison, who won Best Actress, the movie offers a thought-provoking narrative.
Singer Dolly Parton's husband Carl Dean dies at 82Carl Dean, husband of Dolly Parton and inspiration for her hit song, Jolene, has died at the age of 82.

Blackpink's Lisa on her new album Alter Ego: Want people to feel empoweredLisa of Blackpink recently spoke about her new solo album, Alter Ego. In a virtual panel discussion, the singer shared her desire to make listeners feel empowered with her new album.

Taarak Mehta actor Deepti Sadhwani turns showstopper at Milan Fashion WeekTaarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah actor Deepti Sadhwani turned showstopper at Milan Fashion Week. The actor shared stunning photos from her rampwalk.

Kaam Idhar Udhar Hogaya: YouTuber Ashish Chanchlani on India's Got Latent rowYouTuber Ashish Chanchlani got emotional in his first video after his appearance on comedian Samay Raina's India's Got Latent show.

Maharani 4 teaser: Huma Qureshi returns as Rani Bharti to safeguard BiharActor Huma Qureshi is set to return as Rani Bharti in Maharani Season 4. The makers announced the news with the teaser of the upcoming gripping series.

TV show Tenali Rama set catches fire, shoot haltedA fire broke out on the set of TV show Tenali Rama due to a generator malfunction, halting production. There were no casualties, but the set suffered damage and repairs are underway.

Be Happy: Abhishek Bachchan reunites with Ludo co-actor Inayat in feel-good filmThe trailer of Abhishek Bachchan and Inayat Verma's upcoming dance-drama Be Happy was released today. Directed by Remo D'Souza, the heartfelt film will premiere on Prime Video on March 14.

BTS' J-hope's Seoul concert: New song, fan proposal and special appearance by JinBTS member and rapper J-hope recently held a concert in Seoul which was attended by his close friend and singer Kim Seokjin (Jin). The concert was one big event for the fans as it consisted of many other surprises besides the central performance by the artiste.

Khakee The Bengal Chapter: Jeet and Prosenjit announce release date with fun clipThe next installment of Netflix's critically acclaimed thriller series Khakee, Khakee: The Bengal Chapter will premiere on Netflix in March. The makers of the show announced its release date with a fun video.

general news.headline: Ready to work under Trump's strong leadership: Zelenskyy after US pauses aidUkrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that he is ready to work under Donald Trump's leadership for peace and affirmed Ukraine's willingness to negotiate, a day after Trump paused US assistance.

9 killed, 25 injured as 2 bomb blasts rock Pakistan's Khyber PakhtunkhwaThe bomb blasts near Bannu Cantonment in Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, allegedly carried out by Jaish ul Fursan and TTP, targeted a security barrier in a coordinated assault.

Techie, 25, dies by suicide in Telangana over alleged dowry harassmentA 25-year-old woman from Telangana, died by suicide allegedly due to dowry harassment by her husband. Her mother filed a complaint, leading to a police case being filed. The authorities have sent the woman's body for a post-mortem to determine further details.

Canada imposes retaliatory tariffs on US, Trudeau calls Trump's trade move 'dumb'In response to US President Donald Trump's new tariffs on Canadian and Mexican imports, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced 25% retaliatory tariffs on $30 billion worth of US imports.
How to choose the perfect cheese for a health-conscious dietLove cheese but unsure if it should be part of your diet? Let experts help you decide.

US Congressman brands Patidar volleyball casteist, gets schooled by Indian-AmericansUS Congressman Brandon Gill criticised an Indian-origin person on X, branding a Patidar community volleyball match in the US as "casteist". He argued that America had no space for "foreign class allegiances". Gill was schooled by several Indian-Americans, who said such remarks spread anti-India and anti-Hindu hate.

Beat the s*** out of that doctor: US man after assaulting Indian-origin nurseThe Florida hospital patient who brutally attacked an Indian-origin nurse admitted to the hate crime, reported local law enforcement. The attacker was reported to have said, "Indians are bad. I just beat the s*** out of an Indian doctor," sparking outrage and calls for stricter protections.

Shubman Gill follows Sachin Tendulkar, Virat Kohli's footsteps with MRF dealIndia batter Shubman Gill has signed a deal with renowned Tyre brand MRF as his bat sponsor. He joins an elite club of players such as Sachin Tendulkar, Virat Kohli and Brian Lara.

Tamannaah Bhatia, Vijay Varma part ways after dating for 2 years: SourceActors Tamannaah Bhatia and Vijay Varma have parted ways after dating for two years. The duo had made their relationship public in 2023.

Why Dhananjay Munde resigned from Devendra Fadnavis cabinetThe torture and murder of a sarpanch and an extortion case in the NCP leader's Beed district had become a major embarrassment for the Mahayuti government

iPad Air M3 launched in India with a new Magic Keyboard: Prices, specs, offersApple has introduced the latest iPad Air in India, powered by the M3 chip. Here are the details, including India price, specs, and sale offers.

Before fat-shaming Rohit Sharma, Shama Mohamed attacked Virat Kohli in 2018Congress's Shama Mohamed found herself at the centre of controversy over her remarks fat-shaming Rohit Sharma. Now, her 2018 post slamming Virat Kohli has also surfaced.

Toru Dutt, India's first woman poet, took Ramayana global before dying at 21Toru Dutt, India's first-ever woman poet, who wrote in English and French, mastered multiple languages and wrote groundbreaking works before dying at 21. Decades before Sarojini Naidu, she introduced the Ramayana and the Mahabharata to the West, and left a legacy that still influences literature today.

Siddaramaiah faces fresh heat as activist seeks CBI probe in Muda caseKarnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah faces renewed trouble in the MUDA scam case as complainant Snehamayi Krishna moves the High Court, seeking a CBI probe. This comes three weeks after the court dismissed Krishna's earlier plea, ruling that the Lokayukta's investigation was not biased.

Gave advice to Kannada film industry in my own rustic language: DK ShivakumarKarnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar defended his blunt remarks on Kannada cinema and insisted his words were for the industry's good. He also warned that the industry was struggling despite recent successes.

Five reasons why South India is resisting the 'North' pushThe divisions are seen to have only deepened under BJP-led central rule, prompting a fierce confrontation and counter from Opposition-ruled southern states

When Cola War got Indians a cold drink for just Rs 5With its latest advertisement and pricing, Pepsi has launched the latest Cola War against rival Coca-Cola. Timed with the Champions Trophy semi-final match between India and Australia, it coincided with World Obesity Day. Here's all about the Cola War of the '90s that made cold drink affordable to a much larger section of the population.

I made your father: Nitish Kumar's spat with Tejashwi Yadav in Bihar AssemblyTejashwi Yadav, the Leader of Opposition, had hit out at Nitish Kumar, questioning his narrative of Bihar's history before 2005. Nitish Kumar then hit back at Tejashwi Yadav and said he had "made" Lalu Yadav.

A school in UK has removed mirrors from its washrooms. Here's whyA UK school removed mirrors from washrooms to reduce time spent in groups. The decision sparked mixed reactions, adding to the ongoing debate over mirrors and phone bans in schools.

High Court agrees to refer to Sambhal Mosque as 'disputed structure': ReportAllahabad High Court has designated the Sambhal Jama Masjid as a 'disputed site' while hearing a petition by the mosque committee seeking permission for whitewashing, amid claims that the structure was built over a demolished Hindu temple.

'What's wrong with Donald Trump's hands, legs?' Viral visuals spark health buzzVideos showing US President Donald Trump limping, struggling to exit a golf cart, and with bruised hands have sparked speculation about his health.

Video: PM Modi plays with orangutan, feeds lion cub at Vantara animal shelterIn a video, the Prime Minister was seen closely interacting and spending time with various species of animals which have been rehabilitated there.

How an Adani Group port became a Communist state's prideKerala's Vizhinjam Port emerged as the biggest handler of cargo among 15 eastern and southern ports in February. This comes within three months of it being commercially operational. The port became a success story only because Communist veteran and Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan dared to go ahead with the Adani Group project.

Remove Aurangzeb's grave from Maharashtra: BJP's Navneet Rana steps up attackSamajwadi Party's Abu Azmi sparked controversy on Monday by praising Mughal emperor Aurangzeb, contradicting historical accounts. His statements claimed Aurangzeb built temples and was not cruel.

Japan's Oscar-nominated documentary Black Box Diaries won't release in the countryFilmmaker Shiori Ito's Oscar-nominated documentary Black Box Diaries has yet to be aired in her home country, Japan. This comes after Ito's rape allegations against a prominent journalist, Noriyuki Yamaguchi.

Nayanthara rejects 'Lady Superstar' title, says her name is closest to her heartActor Nayanthara has denounced the title of 'Lady Superstar' and requested fans to call her by name. The actor said how her name is something that she holds closest to her heart.

Musician Guy Sebastian on acting debut, Indian roots, and role in Hindi VindiGuy Sebastian, the popular Australian singer, made his acting debut in the film Hindi Vindi alongside Neena Gupta and Mihir Ahuja. In an exclusive chat, he opened up about his Indian roots and working with Gupta.

Comedian Vir Das takes a jibe at Indian award shows after watching OscarsVir Das recently took a dig at Indian award shows in a new Instagram post. The actor-comedian said that it is risky to do 'edgy jokes' at such events.

sports.headline: Virat Kohli on missing semis hundred: Wins matter, not milestonesChampions Trophy 2025: Virat Kohli missed out on a well-deserved hundred by 16 runs, but the former captain played a key role in helping India outclass Australia in Dubai. Kohli said he is no longer particular about milestones and landmarks.

Chase master Virat Kohli fires India into final, sends Australia home Champions Trophy 2025, India vs Australia semifinal: Virat Kohli came up with a solid batting display as India registered a record chase to beat Australia. The Men in Blue qualified for the final of the Champions Trophy for the third successive time.

Kohli emulates Sachin Tendulkar after 8000 runs in ODI chasesVirat Kohli joins Sachin Tendulkar as only the second batter to cross 8000 runs in ODI run-chases, reinforcing his reputation as India's ultimate chase master after anchoring the Champions Trophy semi-final win over Australia.

SA vs NZ, all you need to know: Lahore pitch report, live streamingSouth Africa and New Zealand are all set to lock horns in the second semi-final of the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. Both teams will carry their rich form into the all-important clash.

Watch: Head celebrates Rohit's wicket after captain flops in semisIndia vs Australia, Champions Trophy 2025: Rohit Sharma failed to make use of two extra opportunities in India's run chase of 264. The captain was dismissed for 28 in the 8th over as Australia got their man despite putting him down twice.

India loss hurts, but need to be patient: Pakistan coach JavedAaqib Javed urged patience amid Pakistan's struggles, stressing that frequent coaching changes and lack of stability are hindering progress. He emphasised stability, even as the repeated defeats to India continue to frustrate fans after their Champions Trophy group-stage exit.

Shubman Gill follows Sachin Tendulkar, Virat Kohli's footsteps with MRF dealIndia batter Shubman Gill has signed a deal with renowned Tyre brand MRF as his bat sponsor. He joins an elite club of players such as Sachin Tendulkar, Virat Kohli and Brian Lara.

Shreyas Iyer's run-out of Alex Carey could be turning point: Robin UthappaRobin Uthappa feels that Shreyas Iyer's run-out of Alex Carey could be the turning point in the India vs Australia semi-final in the Champions Trophy 2025. Shreyas pulled off the stunning effort in the 48th over.

Watch: Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma fume at Kuldeep Yadav for not collecting ballIndia captain Rohit Sharma and star batter Virat Kohli were seen fuming at spinner Kuldeep Yadav during their semi final game against Australia in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

Would be nice to play Champions Trophy final in Dubai: Mitchell SantnerChampions Trophy 2025: New Zealand captain Mitchell Santner admitted that he would like to play the Champions Trophy final In Dubai as the track supported spin a lot. New Zealand will face South Africa in the semi-final on March 5 in Lahore.

BCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla to watch semi-final in Pakistan Champions Trophy 2025: BCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla will watch the second semi-final between South Africa and New Zealand from Lahore's Gaddafi Stadium on Wednesday. He will visit Pakistan on a two-day trip.

Shubman Gill follows Sachin Tendulkar, Virat Kohli's footsteps with MRF dealIndia batter Shubman Gill has signed a deal with renowned Tyre brand MRF as his bat sponsor. He joins an elite club of players such as Sachin Tendulkar, Virat Kohli and Brian Lara.

Shreyas Iyer's run-out of Alex Carey could be turning point: Robin UthappaRobin Uthappa feels that Shreyas Iyer's run-out of Alex Carey could be the turning point in the India vs Australia semi-final in the Champions Trophy 2025. Shreyas pulled off the stunning effort in the 48th over.

Watch: Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma fume at Kuldeep Yadav for not collecting ballIndia captain Rohit Sharma and star batter Virat Kohli were seen fuming at spinner Kuldeep Yadav during their semi final game against Australia in the ICC Champions Trophy 2025.

Would be nice to play Champions Trophy final in Dubai: Mitchell SantnerChampions Trophy 2025: New Zealand captain Mitchell Santner admitted that he would like to play the Champions Trophy final In Dubai as the track supported spin a lot. New Zealand will face South Africa in the semi-final on March 5 in Lahore.

BCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla to watch semi-final in Pakistan Champions Trophy 2025: BCCI vice-president Rajeev Shukla will watch the second semi-final between South Africa and New Zealand from Lahore's Gaddafi Stadium on Wednesday. He will visit Pakistan on a two-day trip.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
